body: I have a negative triple tumor in my right breast. I am doing alternative protocols instead of the cut/burn/drug treatment. EGCG was recommended by cancertutor.com in which the product states it will aide in shrinking tumors. I started to take it  and in a short time  the tumor felt smaller and softer. Then I quit and the size returned and the hardness. So I started taking the EGCG again and the tumor is getting smaller and softer so I will continue to take it this time since it proved that it was the tea doing it and not my other protocols. I take it twice a day and add it to water with stevia from Now's Best Stevia. The taste and the result of what it makes the tongue is tolerable for the results I am getting. The stevia helps to drink it. I also sometimes put it in with other teas. Great price and goes a long way. Going alternative will be a 2 year commitment and then continue with some of the protocols for the rest of my journey here on earth. No more garbage and chemicals in my food that is within my power to do.
title: Shrinking my Neg 3 tumor in breast

body: I'm a big fan of supplements to help optimize my physical well being, and have tried many different ones over the years. When it comes to anything that is related to weight loss or dieting, I try them, but am pretty skeptical that they actually work (and certainly most don't). Everyone talks about how great green tea is, but, alas, I don't like it. When I saw that NutriGold had these capsules available, decided to give them a try. I've tried other NutriGold products and have done a lot of research on them. They have very high manufacturing practices and I've been happy with their products.
title: Great product for appetite management!

body: I did not purchase this product as a "weight loss" supplement, but rather as a way to get some of the health benefits from the antioxidants provided in green tea. No supplement is truly going to help you lose weight; only a calorie deficit from your daily diet and/or combination of that along with an exercise program will do it. One word of caution, however: I was taking 2 pills a day (thinking more is better and it is just green tea extract, after all) but discovered I had mildly elevated liver enzymes as a result. My doctor had me cut it out for a few weeks and then I started taking just 1 a day and no more issues. You can google the info on this but it can cause this issue with some people.
title: Despite the "weight loss" claim, get some antioxidants!

body: I decided to try this product because many energy/metabolism/weight loss products are packed with caffeine and this one advertises that it is decaffeinated. I also have felt a huge decrease in hunger and instead of counting the minutes until snack time or meal time, I often look at the clock and I'm surprised that its time to eat. I've not had any stomach aches or odd side effects. I do feel like I've started to have my energy and slept better (though this could also be due to kicking a sugar habit - but some credit still goes to this product for that). This is NOT a miracle weight loss pill, but I have had good results that have helped me stick to my health goals and I'm looking forward to continue using this product.

body: The reason I’m giving this product a 5 stars is because I believe it is a good product at an affordable price. The benefits of green tea are many, from a faster metabolism to antioxidants and even brain health (according to some sources). However, in order to get these benefits, you need to get the correct amounts of EGCG and polyphenols. With this product, you can get the amounts of EGCG and polyphenols you need to get the benefits from green tea (if you were to drink green tea, you would need to drink 4 or more cups to reach this level, and make sure it is brewed at the right temperature). In addition, this tea extract has vitamin C, which helps with your immune system. You get all this at a very good price. Depending on how you take it, one bottle can last from 60 to 120 days, and you only pay about 22 dollars, which is like 11 a month, a pretty good deal. Being a person who has not a lot of money, and who isn’t a fan of brewing and preparing tea, and rushing to the bathroom for drinking too much tea to get the benefits, I chose this product. In addition, I give it 5 stars because of the friendly costumer service. I’ve ordered this product multiple times and I have never had any problem receiving it, and if I did, I’m sure the staff would solve the problem in a timely manner. But I repeat: no problems so far while ordering the product.

body: I am sorry I bought this product. Consumer Reports July 27, 2016 just reported that green tea extract comes poses risks of "Dizziness, ringing in the ears, reduced absorption of iron; exacerbates anemia and glaucoma; elevates blood pressure and heart rate; liver damage; possibly death." body: Magnesium stearate is NOT magnesium.  It is a common, potentially harmful, and totally unnecessary additive, which hinders the absorption of nutrients by the intestines.  Magnesium stearate has a deleterious effect on the immune system by suppressing T cells and forming biofilm, which prevents nutrients from being absorbed.  In large doses it can cause liver toxicity.  Companies use it as a "flow agent" to save time and money by speeding up the manufacturing of cheap supplements.  If you are concerned about your health, avoid supplements with magnesium stearate.
title: Buyer Beware! Contains Magnesium Stearate!

body: Magnesium stearate is NOT magnesium.  It is a common, potentially harmful, and totally unnecessary additive, which hinders the absorption of nutrients by the intestines.  Magnesium stearate has a deleterious effect on the immune system by suppressing T cells and forming biofilm, which prevents nutrients from being absorbed.  In large doses it can cause liver toxicity.  Companies use it as a "flow agent" to save time and money by speeding up the manufacturing of cheap supplements.  If you are concerned about your health, avoid supplements with magnesium stearate.
title: Buyer Beware! Contains Magnesium Stearate!

body: I took this supplement for one day and immediately the same day I started to notice nausea, dizziness and ringing in the ear.  Something felt off so I went home and researched possible side effects.  Green tea extracts have been reported to cause liver toxicity.  I researched an appropriate dosage for someone my weight (110-120 lbs).  The maximum recommended dosage was 500 mg and this one has over 700 mg per pill!  The instructions on the bottle even says that it's OK to take an many as 2 pills a day!  That is way over a safe dosage for any weight range.  I returned the product; the company was kind enough to give me full refund, but I feel that I need to post a warning on Amazon about the possible side effects. I took these pills for health benefits, wanting to get the antioxidants without the caffeine effects that come with drinking the actual tea.  It never occurred to me that the extracts in such dosages can actually harm my body, instead of protect it!  I hope many people will be able to read this review and research the side effects ahead of time before purchasing any green tea extract...
title: The maximum recommended dosage was 500 mg and this one has over ...

body: Honestly I rarely review products, but this one id have to say is my favorite supplement Before i usually eat alot of small snacks throughout the day and i havent been losing any weight and have been gaining slowly so Once i started taking these I take 1 at breakfast and i can last the whole day without even eating anything until dinner if you have troubles with temptation just take 1 in the morning and 1 in the afternoon that should be enough ive lost a few pounds its in no way a Miracle pill but it helps ALOT gives a nice burst of energy as well especially if you start your day with it No jitters!

body: Supplement companies have done an excellent job of marketing supplements like this as weight loss supplements, further increasing sales. That is not what this supplement is. Green Tea Extract has lots of health benefits and taking it can also be a great start to your morning due to the caffeine... however science has shown in study after study that green tea along with garcinia cambogia (SP?) have little effect, if any on weight loss. Any resulting weight loss you get from taking this product is actually more likely than anything to be the cause of healthier eating or more exercise - caffeine is also a diuretic, so it could potentially be a loss of water weight if you're not drinking enough fluids. This product does what its intended to do - and that's not weight loss (and that's not what I bought it for). The only reason I ranked this product 3 stars is because the company is very misleading to buyers, marketing this as a weight loss supplement when it is in fact not - THERE IS NO MAGIC PILL OR MAGIC SUPPLEMENT.
title: Not a Weight Loss Supplement

I bought them for the EGCG and catechins, and for the reason that green tea extract has been studied by medical researchers looking at uterine fibroids. I will be having uterine fibroid removal surgery soon and wanted to start using these to help me possibly either slowing or preventing my fibroids from coming back after the surgery.

body: I had some of the most intense pain from uterine fibroids in June (2015). My wedding was super stressful until the date of 4/11/15 and kicked my body way off balance. Normally I drink a lot of green tea, but 2 months before our wedding I stopped and drank coffee instead to stay awake. The fibroids grew at an alarming rate and until I went to the emergency room for testing, didn't know what it was. I immediately started back on my green tea regimen and ordered these pills and within a week I was pain free. No one knows the dull debilitating ache of fibroids until it renders you immobilized in your bed! I do and don't want to go back. I take 3 everyday as a preventative measure and from what I read the amount of catechins are the highest percentage you can get with this price. I feel healthier and have gotten back to normal. Once I go back to the doctors, I can see how much the fibroids have shrank down with the help of these AMAZING capsules!!!
title: Pain free and happy!

body: I use this because I have a genetic disposition called COMT Val/Val (tend to not be able to focus until stressed, then thrive). Tea catechins are supposed to help with the effects of this condition, with green tea having the most, but I didn't want the caffeine (I've been caffeine free for years and didn't want to get hooked again). It isn't magic pixie dust, but it does seem to make some difference in my mood and ability to concentrate. If you are COMT Met/Met (tend to get overwhelmed by stress), then any tea will make things worse for you, including this. ~ 25% of people are Val/Val and 25% are Met/Met (the rest are Met/Val or "normal"). I have lost a small amount of weight since I started taking this, but I couldn't say if it is because of it (though being able to be more productive certainly helps).
title: Seems to help with COMT Val/Val

body: After reading the book "surviving terminal cancer" I started to buy lots of supplements for my husband, to help him battle his terminal brain cancer. I buy resveratrol, high quality fish oil, vitamin D3, melatonin, quercetin, lycopene, garlic, green tea, boswellia, milk thistle, mushrooms (Coriolus, chaga, etc), CoQ10, selenium, curcumin, berberine, and a few other ones. So far he is tolerating chemo really well and tumor continues to shrink substantially. The downside of these supplements is that it can be quite expensive but the quality is very high. Life extension does a lot of research and their products are very high quality. You know you are getting the strength it says on the bottle. I don't dare buy from a cheaper company that does not do individual test to make sure their quality is outstanding. Capsules are also easy to swallow (my husband takes a hand full with no problems!
title: Great supplement to help battle cancer

body: I too use this to slow my CLL.  The Mayo Clinic Study mentioned below found improvements in lymph node shrinkage or lower WBC, or both, in 60% of CLL patients during their two clinical studies.  Then the Japanese supplier used by Mayo stopped making their pure testing preparation because there was more money in hard tumor research. So the third planned study never happened. But the dosage is 4,000 (yes, four thousand mgs) daily.  So I am taking twelve of these a day (2 X 6 daily).  I have been doing so for a year.  It's hard to tell what effect this is having on my leukemia, but my lab results seem to be pretty stable.  This was recommended by my oncologist, a CLL specialist.  This must be taken with food or within an hour or so of eating.  There have been very significant and very clear benefits beyond the CLL issue.  All of my typical  "normal" prostate issues have resolved.  I'm 62 and had no real problems with prostate issues, but I am, excuse me, peeing like a twenty year old again.  Also, the weight loss benefit is very real. But this dosage is huge. Here is the link to the Mayo study: [...] If amazon strikes the link Google "mayo clinic - green tea extract.
title: CLL (leukemia) Usage and Real Benefits Otherwise

body: I have no idea what people are complaining about in regards to these green tea extract pills.  No, they aren't hard to swallow.  Put one in your mouth and drink some fluid.  Not tricky.  If you can swallow an aspirin you can manage one of these.  Sure they don't taste great.  Do you normally savor the flavor of your vitamins?  Me neither.  The only valid complaint I have read is that they are not decaf.  But I have to say that 27 mg is NOT a lot of caffeine.  It's half a 8 oz. cup of coffee.  Not anything that would send a normal adult crawling across the ceiling.  So if you are in the market for green tea extract, these deliver.
title: They are what they say they are

body: These work great for me. The trick to taking them is to put them in the back of your throat and take a drink. If you move them around in your mouth, they taste horrible. Just swallow them as fast as you can. I lost 10 lbs taking these, but that doesn't happen overnight. Also, these are very good for toothaches, if taken for awhile. They keep the bacteria down in your gums. That's my experience. These are the only ones I buy. I have tried other brands with not such good luck. Also, I take these with food.

If I take it alone, along with water it is fine. However, this is not a product you want to take with your morning coffee as it will stick to your tongue, start dissolving rapidly, and hit you with a very bitter experience. I suspect the reason for good and bad reviews about the taste have much to do with how it is taken. I generally take several supplements at a time. That does not work with this supplement as I find it demands to be taken alone with a big gulp of water which is OK just not how I typically take my morning supplements. I will probably opt for a different brand in a gel cap next time; something that is more coffee friendly.

body: When buying this product, you should know that it is a brick of the extract.  There is no coating on the outside, no gelatin capsule.  I am generally not good at swallowing pills - without the coating, this product is really hard for me to swallow.  It's not a huge pill (like a fish oil pill), it just can stick to your pallet/throat.  In my view, the difficulty in swallowing is not worth the cheap price.  On the other hand, it seems to be a good-quality extract in terms of it's EGCG content.  I have no reservations about it's quality; it's not a "weird chemical"; it is the extract dissolving as you try to swallow it.

body: Ok so I was sketchy on this stuff and purchased it from Amazon since its the overall best deal around. Read the reviews on this site and Bodybuilder forum and thought its worth a shot. This stuff is the dirty cheap and actually works! I work out 3 times a week and cardio in between adn have some what of a good diet. I stay away from bad carbs and the junk drive through fast foods. I am 5-8" and weighed in at 158lbs and dropped down to 150lbs. ITs been about a 1 month and 3 weeks since I started this stuff and I am on my second bottle. I also took off 1.5 inches off my waist, down to a 33.5 inches in waist. I used this for leaning out and get body fat down, and oh my goodness does this stuff AMP you up!... Stay way from takin non natural caffeine in excess when droppin this stuff, make your head pop off! LOL... I take one in the morning with my oatmeal and then drop another one after a sensible lunch (tuna sammy), I do not take one past 5pm or else I cannot go to bed. Lots of energy through out the day, by any means is this a miracle pill, but does increase your chances or gives a lil kick to drop some LBS along with regular workouts and good eating habits. I would highly recommend this stuff and its worth a shot and cant beat the price!
title: NOW Green Tea Extract is the Bomb!

body: I was using the knock-off store brand version of the Mega-T green tea fat burner supplement with no real effects. I was in desperate need of some kind of appetite suppressant in yet another quest to lose my post-pregnancy weight because, even though I am good at counting calories, I can't seem to control my cravings for sweet things and to eat in general. I'll do good for part of the day and then mess up because I'll look at a piece of cake in my fridge and it will just jump right into my mouth. Since I have been on these pills for the last couple of days I have not had the extreme and constant desire to CONSUME. And this is even with drinking and filling up on about 9 8oz. glasses of water a day and taking in good fiber. Last week I devised a simple, easy to use chart to log my food and diet activities (exercise, vitamin consumption, etc.) and noticed that by midday I would have consumed more than half of my daily cut down calories. Not good at all. Right now I am making healthier choices in food and limiting myself from 1200-1450 calories (based on what internet calculators say I need to consume to lose weight) keeping fat at 20-25% of those totals and carbs at 50% (not really concerned with protein numbers right now). That along with at least 25 grams of fiber a day. I took my first pills today at around 8AM and it is 11AM right now and I have only logged 290 calories, 2 grams of fat, 49 carbs and 7 grams of fiber! By this time yesterday I was very close to 600 calories alone. I also have a lot of energy to boot. I do agree that you have to drink a lot of water when you take these pills to stave off nausea/the jitters. I take 2 pills twice a day, in the morning and early-mid afternoon. The box says to take 2 in the AM and 1-2 in the PM. I can see if you take these pills too late in the day you will be up past your bedtime. Right now, I've weighed 150# (my pregnancy weight minus the actual baby) and have not gone up and down for the last 7 months. I used to be a steady 125# at 5'2" until I got pregnant. At age 36 my metabolism seems to have gone out the window too now. I can't wait to see how things develop over the next few months. I've been working out lightly (walking/backpacking/weights/stationary bike) for 20-30 minutes a day, taking a multi some brand name calcium pills, fiber pills with chromium and will soon to add omega 3 fish oil (all of which I have read up assist in weight loss and are generally good for you anyway). For the minimal bad sweet cravings now one or 2 of those hard caramel grandma candies and homemade airpopped popcorn with varied/custom healthy spices/toppings or reduced fat Triscuits for salty cravings. Homemade broth made with a poached skinless chicken breast and veggies (put in fridge and skim the extra fat) helps a lot as well. I just bought the 30 pack of pills at my local retail big box store to try it out for around eight dollars. They are great to take about 60 minutes before a work out for that extra push. I will definitely be investing in more of these pills.
title: FIVE STARS! THANKS :)

body: I took two in the morning as directed. I felt a lot of energy without jitters! I really liked that. It also curbed my "mindless munching" that i struggle so much with later in the day. I forgot to take the second dose but thank god I did because I was up all night. I mean till 7am!! Next day I only took one when i woke up but I didn't feel that great energy feeling like the day before maybe because I was so exhausted from staying up all night. I also had a splitting headache that lasted all day. That night I went to sleep but not until 2am. Following day i only took one in the morning then again struggled all day with another headache and only a little energy. I didn't feel that hungry. Just a normal hunger and still didn't feel like munching. I decided to skip a day to see if the headache would go away and it did. I was kinda disappointed because I really liked the energy and the gentle curb of hunger. I'm gonna try it again in a couple days after it leaves my system to see if the lower dose maybe doesn't cause another headache but I honestly think it causes me to have them.

body: I was researching safe "fatburners" as well as something that would help to suppress my appetite when I came across "green tea Fatburners." I read every review and even researched the FDA website to determine the safest products on the market. The good thing about this product (for me at least) is there were little to no side effects, minus a light headache if I didn't drink enough water. I have been on this product for about a month and have followed the recommended doses: two pills in the morning and two in the afternoon. They helped to suppress my appetite to some extent and control bad eating habits (ie. junk food)I have lost a few pounds to date, but I am also working out agressively and drinking more water. I will continue to take the rest of this product to determine how much weight it helped me to lose overall!!

After taking my 1st few pills, I wasn't sure if it was placebo or not, but I gradually experienced a huge burst of energy and alertness. I always approach supplements like this as a skeptic, but days and weeks following this, and taking many more, it was consistent with the results and effects. After running out of the pills, I didn't take them for a few weeks and  already felt the typical drowsiness that I naturally experience at work. Soon enough I would buy these particular ones with EGCG (A good amount is 400 MG daily) and started my routine again.

body: I started taking these as a "I've tried everything else" reason.  Now 2 1/2 years later I've lost over 140lbs!  It started 6 lbs to 8 lbs a month the first 1 1/2 years then down to 1 to 4 over the next year.  It has slowed down where 2 months ago I lost 0lbs, but the next month I lost 3lbs.  I started taking it with Align (probiotic) and won't stop taking either one now- I have 38 more lbs to be at the doctors "goal weight" it was 1985 (my freshman year in high school) the last time I weighed this amount!  Now if I could find someone who was willing to take all of this hanging skin off for little to no $ I would be the happiest 42 year old disabled woman on the planet!  NEVER quit making this product- it is a god send for me!  I have always tried to lose weight- but I can honestly say I didn't change anything in my diet or exersizing to lose this (I do eat a lot less just because I'm not hungry and seem to be more active just from the weight being off) so if you have tried everything else I would highly recommend giving this a try!

I had a hard time at first going out to walk, but wanted to see if the plan would work and I can easily say, it did.  Good luck to you! body: I decided to try this product because I have elevated cortisol levels and green tea can sometimes be a natural balancer of cortisol. I have been taking one 500mg capsule daily for two months now, and I am amazed at how well it is working for me. Unless I forget to take it, I have almost no anxiety (one major symptom of elevated cortisol). This, in combination with a healthy diet and exercise program, is helping me to very gradually lose weight, something that was not happening with diet and exercise alone. Please, please, please don't take this as a lose weight fast diet pill. You will be disappointed, and you could do a lot of harm to your body. I would encourage any potential buyer to do as much research as possible before taking. There are certain drugs such as that found in cold and sinus medication that is not compatible with green tea suppliments. It has diuretic effects, so it is important to drink lots of water throughout the day to reduce kidney stress. There are many great websites that describe potential side effects and drug interactions. Even though this is a naturally derived suppliment, it can be very potent and should be treated as any other type of medication. It does have natural caffeine from the green tea leaves, but no added caffeine.  For me, it has done a remarkable job of bringing my cortisol levels back within a normal range, and I am so thankful someone told me about it.
title: Wonderful Product; great for reducing elevated cortisol levels; NOT A DIET PILL

body: I decided to try this product because I have elevated cortisol levels and green tea can sometimes be a natural balancer of cortisol. I have been taking one 500mg capsule daily for two months now, and I am amazed at how well it is working for me. Unless I forget to take it, I have almost no anxiety (one major symptom of elevated cortisol). This, in combination with a healthy diet and exercise program, is helping me to very gradually lose weight, something that was not happening with diet and exercise alone. Please, please, please don't take this as a lose weight fast diet pill. You will be disappointed, and you could do a lot of harm to your body. I would encourage any potential buyer to do as much research as possible before taking. There are certain drugs such as that found in cold and sinus medication that is not compatible with green tea suppliments. It has diuretic effects, so it is important to drink lots of water throughout the day to reduce kidney stress. There are many great websites that describe potential side effects and drug interactions. Even though this is a naturally derived suppliment, it can be very potent and should be treated as any other type of medication. It does have natural caffeine from the green tea leaves, but no added caffeine.  For me, it has done a remarkable job of bringing my cortisol levels back within a normal range, and I am so thankful someone told me about it.
title: Wonderful Product; great for reducing elevated cortisol levels; NOT A DIET PILL
